alert.note: Alert for Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Custer County through 400 AM CDT... At 314 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Anselmo to near Broken Bow. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Broken Bow, Sargent, Merna, Anselmo, Comstock, Berwyn, Victoria Springs State Recreation Area, Weissert, Westerville, Lillian, Round Valley, Walworth, Arcadia Diversion Dam State Wildlife Management Area, Wescott, Big Oak Canyon, Divide Hill and Gates. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 92 and 121. Highway 2 between mile markers 248 and 292. Highway 92 between mile markers 271 and 273, and near mile marker 308. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
